授業目的: The purpose of this course is to help doctoral candidates develop their academic writing skills prior to the submission of their theses.
到達目標: Students write their theses for submission by the faculty deadline, making individual appointments to discuss their drafts as required. These are not simply opportunities to have your work checked by a native speaker but an essential part of the learning process. Above all, it is hoped that students will learn to avoid basic errors and develop a sound academic style of their own.
授業方法: Students submit each chapter of their work when ready for correction, and meet by appointment for advice on rewriting and development.

トピック.授業計画1: Contact during the autumn semester is mainly by email.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are required to submit at least 7,500 words of their complete thesis by a date agreed at the beginning of the semester (but no less than two weeks before the official date of submission).

評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0: For advice on academic style and formatting you are recommended to consult the latest MLA handbook (https://style.mla.org).
